main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a bright, egg-shaped object in the sky over Greensburg, Pennsylvania on April 11, 1966.
interesting points: The object was initially observed as the size of a quarter, then changed to a larger, brighter object,The observer reported a swishing, whistling sound associated with the object,The object moved behind a cloud and reappeared, contributing to the observer's belief it was an aircraft,The object's color was described as a bright clear white,The sighting lasted between 2 to 5 minutes.
witness description: 43-year-old male, trained clinical student of atomic mechanics
